Package main

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.CLILogger
      • main.Graph
  • public class Graph
extends CLILogger
    A class for a directed graph.

    It can be used with the Dijkstra class to find minimum distances from all nodes to one starting node.

        stores the destination of an edge

        the first unused index (of edges, it seems)

        private double[] weight
        stores the weight of a edge

      • latitude

        private double[] latitude
        stores the latitude of a node

      • longitude

        private double[] longitude
        stores the longitude of a node

      • distance

        private double[] distance
        stores the distance to a node

      • predecessor

        private int[] predecessor
        stores any node's preceding node on the ideal path from Dijkstra's starting node to that node, if Dijkstra's algorithm has been run. Values will be -1 if there is no path or if Dijkstra has not run yet.

      • start

        private int start
        the starting node used to check if dijkstra did run for this node

      • heap

        private NodeHeap heap
        Heap to be given to Dijkstra class. Musz be reset and given new starting node before running Dijkstra again.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Graph

        public Graph​(int nodes,
             int edges)
        Constructor.

        Edges have to be manually added to the graph using the method insertEdge().

        Parameters:
        nodes - number of nodes that are used in the graph
        edges - number of edges that are to be used in the graph
        See Also:
        insertEdge(int, int, double)

      throws UnorderedGraphException
        adds a new Edge to the Graph
        Parameters:
        start - the start node
        dest - the destination node
        weight - the weight
        Throws:
        UnorderedGraphException - A special Exception which tells caller to try insert method

      • increase

        private double[] increase​(double[] arr)
        increases the length of a double array

        If array is a known array to this class e.g latitude it will automatically be replaced

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the increased array

      • hasOutgoingEdges

        public boolean hasOutgoingEdges​(int node)
        Checks if a node has a outgoing edge
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if has outgoing edge else false
        See Also:
        getOffset(int)

      • getOffset

        public int getOffset​(int node)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the Offset of a node. Will return -1 if A) no edges exist for given node B) given node index is the first index beyond the node array (node == offset.length), meaning that node does not exist. This is to simplify iterative operations.

        Other non-existent nodes will result in an exception.

        Parameters:
        node - the node
        Returns:
        the offset or -1 if it has no edges.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if node index is < 0 or node index > offset.length

      • setOffset

        void setOffset​(int node,
               int offset)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the offset of a node, does nothing if parameter is 1 above highest node ID.
        Parameters:
        node - the node
        offset - the offset
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - only if node does not exist and isn't equal to offset.length

      • nextNode

        int nextNode​(int node)
        Returns the node which is nearest to [node]
        Parameters:
        node - the node
        Returns:
        the next node or -1 if it does not exist

      • countOutgoingEdges

        public int countOutgoingEdges​(int node)
        Returns the number of outgoing edges
        Parameters:
        node - the node
        Returns:
        number of outgoing edges, 0 if none found

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight​(int edge)
        Returns weight of an edge
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge
        Returns:
        weight or -1 if it doesn't exist

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance​(int dest)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the distance
        Parameters:
        dest - the destination node
        Returns:
        the distance to a node or POSITIVE_INFINITY if Dijkstra did not run yet or if unreachable
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if node index is out of bounds

      • setDistance

        public boolean setDistance​(int dest,
                           double dist)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the Distance to dest.
        Parameters:
        dest - the destination node
        dist - the distance
        Returns:
        true if distance has changed else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dest index is out of bounds

      • setPredecessor

        public void setPredecessor​(int node,
                           int predecessor)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the node's predecessor on a path from Dijkstra's starting node to given node. Used by Dijkstra class while the algorithm runs.
        Parameters:
        node - The node of which a predecessor gets set.
        predecessor - The preceding node on a path to Dijkstra's start.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if node index is out of bounds

      • getPredecessor

        public int getPredecessor​(int node)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the node's predecessor on a path from Dijkstra's starting node to given node. The starting node is set when creating an instance of Dijkstra's algorithm for this graph. If there is no path or if Dijkstra has not run yet, -1 will be returned!
        Parameters:
        node - From this node, by going to the returned node and that one's predecessors, you can recursively find the ideal path to the starting node.
        Returns:
        preceding node on a path to start, or -1
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if node index is out of bounds

      • getNodeList

        int[] getNodeList()
        Returns list of all nodes with their offsets
        Returns:
        offset array

      • getDestination

        public int getDestination​(int edge)
        Returns the destination node of edge
        Parameters:
        edge - The Edge
        Returns:
        destination of given edge

      • getCurrentEdgesCount

        public int getCurrentEdgesCount()
        Returns amount of edges that have been added to this directed graph.

      • getMaxEdgesCount

        public int getMaxEdgesCount()
        Returns maximum number of edges supported in this directed graph.

        This value is determined upon construction of a graph instance via parameter 'edges'.

      • getNodesCount

        public int getNodesCount()
        Returns the amount of nodes in the graph.

      • getStartingNode

        public int getStartingNode()
        returns most recently set starting node for this graph, which is the start of a route when running Dijkstra
        Returns:
        start as integer between 0 and getNodesCount()

      • getClosestNode

        public int getClosestNode​(double latitide,
                          double longitude)
        Returns the node in this graph that is the closest to the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        latitide - latitude in degrees
        longitude - longitude in degrees
        Returns:
        node as an integer number between 0 and getNodesCount()

      • getGeoDistance

        public static double getGeoDistance​(double lat1,
                                    double lng1,
                                    double lat2,
                                    double lng2)
        Calculates rough distance in m between two points on earth given as latitude and longitude. This is a helper method for getClosestNode() in the Graph class.
        Parameters:
        lat1 - Latitude of point 1
        lng1 - Longitude of point 1
        lat2 - Latitude of point 2
        lng2 - Longitude of point 2
        Returns:
        distance in meters as double

      • getLatitude

        public double[] getLatitude()

      • getLongitude

        public double[] getLongitude()

      • getNode

        public int getNode​(double latitude,
                   double longitude)
        Returns node for given geoLocations
        Parameters:
        latitude - The latitude
        longitude - The longitude
        Returns:
        The node number or -1
